Following the incident that took place on Monday, angry locals launched a protest and blocked the main road, demanding arrest of the culprits, police added. It's reportedly the third such incident in Jammu in the past three months.

175.title: Dog beaten, tied to a bomb by Russian soldiers to kill its rescuers in Ukraine
175.article_body: Russian soldiers beat a dog and tied it to a bomb to kill Ukrainian civilians coming to its rescue. Residents in Makariv, north west of Kyiv, called Ukrainian bomb disposal experts to rescue the canine. The dog, whose owner could not be found, has been named Fox and is making a recovery.

176.title: Euro reaches parity with US dollar for the first time in 20 years
176.article_body: The euro sank on Tuesday to reach parity with US dollar for the first time in 20 years. The currency fell to an intraday low of $1 amid concerns that an energy crisis could plunge the region's economy into recession. The concerns come after the biggest single pipeline carrying Russian natural gas to Europe was shutdown for maintenance.

177.title: Thank you Sri Lanka for hosting us during an extremely difficult time: Warner
177.article_body: After the conclusion of Australia's tour of Sri Lanka, David Warner shared a picture of the Sri Lankan flag and thanked the country for hosting them amid the economic and political crisis. "What I love about your amazing country is no matter the circumstances you always have a smile on your face and are always so welcoming," wrote Warner.

178.title: KL Rahul to marry Athiya Shetty in next 3 months in Mumbai: Reports
178.article_body: Cricketer KL Rahul will tie the knot with actress Athiya Shetty in the next three months, as per reports. "The wedding is expected to take place in next three months in Mumbai. It'll be a grand celebration for both families and every detail of...wedding is been overseen by the bride herself," India Today reported quoting a source as saying.

179.title: Govt releases list of 4 participants of India's 1st 5G spectrum auction
179.article_body: The Centre has released a list naming Adani Data Networks, Reliance Jio, Bharti Airtel and Vodafone Idea as the participants of India’s first 5G spectrum auction which will be held on July 26. A total of 72,097.85 MHz of airwaves will be auctioned and the winner will have the right to use the spectrum for 20 years.

180.title: Outlandish: Depp's lawyers on Heard asking for dismissal of trial verdict
180.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp's lawyers have called his ex-wife Amber Heard's request to dismiss the verdict of the defamation trial "outlandish". Heard's team had alleged that the wrong juror sat during the trial. Depp's team has argued that Heard's team should have spoken up at the time of the trial if they had concerns, adding that the juror was vetted.

181.title: Suryakumar has to play in 1st ODI vs England: Michael Vaughan
181.article_body: Former England captain Michael Vaughan has said Suryakumar Yadav has to play in the first ODI against England. "Suryakumar just played the most ridiculous innings," he added, referring to the 31-year-old's 117-run innings in the final T20I against England. "India have got so much quality and depth that they have just got to get the combinations right," Vaughan further said.

182.title: Secretary of Swapna Suresh's NGO arrested for threatening tribals in Kerala
182.article_body: Secretary of an NGO named High Range Rural Development Society (HRDS) which had employed Swapna Suresh, the key accused in Kerala's gold smuggling case, was arrested for allegedly threatening tribals in Palakkad. The Sholayur Police arrested the accused, Aji Krishnan, based on a complaint filed by a local tribal member. Notably, Krishnan has been booked under the SC/ST Atrocities Act.

183.title: Pune civic body to appoint agency to check green growth on bridges
183.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has floated a tender to appoint an agency to clear city bridges of green growth. "The agency appointed...will use crane(s) and other machinery to clear the plant growth as bridges are tall. The agency will use chemicals to check green growth," a PMC official said. PMC will also appoint an agency for the maintenance of bridges.

184.title: House of accused in Assam animal rights activist suicide case demolished
184.article_body: The house of Baidullah Khan, an accused in animal rights activist Vineet Bagaria's suicide case, was demolished on Tuesday by authorities in Assam's Dibrugarh. "The house was constructed without having the necessary building permits. The structure was unstable and unfit for people to reside," Dibrugarh DC said. Bagaria had died by suicide at his residence on July 7.

185.title: Father of school shooting victim shouts at US President during his speech; video surfaces
185.article_body: US President Joe Biden was heckled by the father of a school shooting victim during a White House event on Monday. Biden was talking about passage of a gun control bill when Manuel Oliver, whose son died in Parkland, Florida, in 2018, shouted that the US President must "do more". "Sit down...Let me finish my comments," Biden was heard saying.

186.title: Water level rises in 7 lakes used for supplying water to Mumbai
186.article_body: The water level has increased in the seven lakes supplying water to Mumbai due to continuous heavy rainfall. The combined water stock of all seven lakes has shot up to 5.8 lakh million litres of their total capacity or 40% of the annual total. The seven lakes are - Modak Sagar, Tansa, Vihar, Tulsi, Upper Vaitarna, Middle Vaitarna and Bhatsa.

187.title: Truck hits vehicle parked to change tyre in Punjab; 3 dead, 1 hurt
187.article_body: Three people were killed and one person was injured after a canter truck rammed into a pick-up truck parked on the roadside and its occupants who were changing the vehicle's tyre in Punjab's Dera Bassi on Monday. The deceased included the canter truck's driver. The canter truck's front was left completely damaged from the impact of the collision.

188.title: I learnt some incredible personal life lessons from Brad Pitt: Joey King
188.article_body: During her interview with Men's Journal, Joey King said Brad Pitt's 'Bullet Train' is "a larger-than-life film" that the actress can't believe she's a part of. "I learnt a lot from Brad, some incredible personal life lessons. He's been in the public eye for so long," she added. "Brad was so gracious in helping someone like me," she said.

189.title: My focus is definitely on 2023 WC: Dhawan ahead of 1st ODI vs England
189.article_body: Ahead of first India-England ODI, India opener Shikhar Dhawan said he has been practising for England ODIs and he's sure he'll be in fine rhythm in coming matches. "My focus is definitely on next year's World Cup...for that, I want to play as many matches as possible for India and do well there," he added. Match will be played today.

190.title: Former Himachal Pradesh BJP chief Khimi Ram joins Congress
190.article_body: Former Himachal Pradesh BJP chief Khimi Ram joined the Congress on Tuesday. Ram, a former minister and deputy speaker in the state, said he is not joining the Congress "out of any anger towards BJP". "I have taken a well-thought-out decision to take...Congress forward in Himachal Pradesh," Ram said. He was sworn in at AICC headquarters in New Delhi.

191.title: National flag temporarily removed from Hyd's tallest post to prevent damage
191.article_body: The Hyderabad authority has temporarily taken down the national flag from the tallest flag post in the city to prevent it from any damage amid the strong winds forecast for the city. The height of the flag post, located on the banks of Hussain Sagar Lake in Sanjeevaiah Park, is around 88 metres and it weighs over 65 kilograms.

192.title: The first-known pregnant mummy had cancer, reveals new study
192.article_body: A new study by Polish scientists said that the first-known pregnant Egyptian mummy had cancer in the nasopharynx (upper part of the throat behind the nose). The revelations were made when unusual markings were found in the nasopharyngeal bones of the mummy's skull. The woman is suspected to have had a malignant tumour and likely died from it, researchers said.

193.title: 5 districts in Delhi report deficient monsoon rains so far: IMD
193.article_body: Five districts in Delhi have reported deficient monsoon rains so far this year due to poor rainfall distribution, the IMD data stated. West Delhi and Southwest Delhi have recorded a rainfall deficit of 60% and 51%, respectively. On the other hand, Northeast Delhi has logged a shortfall of 43%, followed by Central Delhi at 29% and South Delhi at 22%.

194.title: Chivas Regal maker Pernod Ricard puts new India investments on hold: Report
194.article_body: French spirits group Pernod Ricard, the maker of Chivas Regal, Glenlivet Scotch whisky and Absolut vodka has put its new Indian investments on hold over long-running tax disputes with authorities on valuing liquor imports, as per a report. The company had also written a letter to PM Narendra Modi in November seeking a resolution in the matter.

195.title: PM Modi inaugurates Deoghar Airport in J'khand, flags off flight to Kolkata
195.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday inaugurated the 657-acre Deoghar Airport, constructed at a cost of ₹401 crore, in Jharkhand. The PM also flagged off the Deoghar-Kolkata IndiGo flight from the new airport, which has a 2,500-metre-long runway. Union Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya M Scindia said the airport will be linked to Ranchi, Patna and Delhi in the upcoming days.

196.title: No science to predict isolated extreme rain: Govt on Amarnath tragedy
196.article_body: After IMD said that the weather event at Amarnath was not a cloudburst but localised extreme rainfall, the Ministry of Earth Sciences Secretary Dr M Ravichandran said that no country has the science to make a forecast for such an event yet. "Just as there's no science to predict an earthquake, there's none for isolated extremely heavy rainfall," he said.

197.title: Japanese flock Tokyo streets to bid farewell to ex-PM Abe at funeral
197.article_body: Hundreds of Japanese citizens flocked streets of Tokyo to bid their final goodbyes to ex-PM Shinzo Abe on Tuesday as a private funeral service was held at a temple days after his assassination. The hearse carrying Abe's body passed through several significant buildings, including the Prime Minister's Office and parliament building. Abe will be cremated at city's Kirigaya Funeral Hall.

198.title: Russia reports its first case of monkeypox
198.article_body: Russia's consumer safety watchdog Rospotrebnadzor on Tuesday said that the country has detected its first case of monkeypox. "The infection was found in a young man who came back from a trip through European countries," it added. "The disease is proceeding in a mild form. There is no threat to life," it further said.

199.title: Lawrence Bishnoi bought ₹4 lakh rifle to kill Salman Khan in 2018: Report
199.article_body: Gangster Lawrence Bishnoi, who's being questioned in connection with Sidhu Moosewala's murder, has allegedly revealed during interrogation that he "wanted to kill" Salman Khan in 2018 over the 1998 blackbuck poaching case. According to a report, Bishnoi allegedly confessed to sending messages to his associate Sampat Nehra to kill Salman. The gangster reportedly also ordered a rifle for ₹4 lakh.

200.title: Cannot compare Suryakumar Yadav to AB de Villiers: Sanjay Manjrekar
200.article_body: Following Suryakumar Yadav's 117 in the third T20I against England comprising 14 fours and six sixes, Sanjay Manjrekar said Suryakumar cannot be compared to AB de Villiers. "AB did that many years back what Surya's doing currently," added Manjrekar. Suryakumar had a strike rate of 212.72. Parthiv Patel stated that it might be the best knock in India's T20I history.

201.title: Video of reverse waterfall in Maharashtra's Naneghat goes viral
201.article_body: A video of a reverse waterfall from Maharashtra's Naneghat has gone viral on social media. In the video, water can be seen sprawling upwards instead of falling down. Naneghat is a mountain pass between the Konkan coast and the ancient town of Junnar in Deccan plateau in the Western Ghats.

202.title: Which are the top 10 best cities in the world in 2022 as per Time Out?
202.article_body: As per the Time Out 2022 Index, Scotland's capital Edinburgh has been named the best city in the world. It is followed by Chicago, Medellin, Glasgow, Amsterdam, Prague and Marrakech. Berlin, Montreal and Copenhagen complete the top 10. Meanwhile, Mumbai has been ranked 14th, while Delhi has been ranked 26th.

203.title: Heroin worth more than ₹350 crore seized at Gujarat’s Mundra port
203.article_body: The anti-terrorist squad (ATS) of Gujarat and the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) seized more than 70 kg of heroin worth over ₹350 crore during a joint operation at Mundra port on Tuesday. Gujarat DGP Ashish Bhatia is likely to hold a press conference to share the details of the operation, The Indian Express reported.

204.title: Russian military equipment damaged in Ukraine go on display in Prague
204.article_body: Russian military equipment destroyed by Ukrainian Armed Forces amid the ongoing war has gone on display in the Czech Republic's capital, Prague. The exhibition features a damaged T-90 tank, Buk air defence system, Khosta self-propelled mortar, Msta howitzer and casings and fragments from rockets and missiles among other things. The exhibition was organised by Ukraine's Interior Ministry.

205.title: Social activist Medha Patkar booked for misusing donation funds
205.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh police have booked social activist Medha Patkar and 11 others for allegedly misleading people to donate to her trust for the welfare of the people of Narmada valley. The FIR also accuses them of misusing the funds for political and anti-national agenda. "We have...audit report...for every question regarding the financial status," Patkar said while refuting the allegations.

206.title: ODI format is great to bring Virat Kohli back into form: RP Singh
206.article_body: Ahead of India's first ODI against England, ex-India pacer RP Singh has said that the 50-over format is great to bring Virat Kohli back into form. "There's not too much pressure of scoring, his fitness is great so he can rotate strike consistently. The demands are higher in the T20 format," explained Singh. The first ODI will be played today.

207.title: SC extends Bhima-Koregaon case accused Varavara Rao's interim bail
207.article_body: The Supreme Court on Tuesday extended the interim bail granted on medical grounds to activist Varavara Rao in the Bhima-Koregaon case. "The interim protection enjoyed by the petitioner will enure to his benefit till further orders," the court ruled. Rao had challenged the April 13 order of the Bombay High Court rejecting his plea for permanent bail on medical grounds.

208.title: Bangladesh on standby to host Asia Cup amid crisis in Sri Lanka: Reports
208.article_body: The Asian Cricket Council has reportedly kept Bangladesh on standby to host the next month's Asia Cup tournament as the current host, Sri Lanka, is going through a political and economic crisis. The ACC does not want to take any risk in this matter and will arrive at a final decision later this month, a report said.

209.title: K'taka minister's gunman returns lost chain, minister shares owner's letter
209.article_body: Karnataka Health Minister K Sudhakar took to Twitter to share a letter by a lady who had lost her gold chain in mall. Sudhakar said that his gunman Anjan Kumar found and returned chain. "The letter penned by woman thanking Anjan makes me proud. Well done Anjan!" he wrote on Twitter. Letter said Anjan found the chain on July 10.

210.title: High resolution cameras to come up at Delhi bus stops, monitoring ideas invited
210.article_body: The Delhi transport department is planning to install high-resolution cameras at all bus queue shelters across city. An official said they have invited proposals from technology companies for ideas about ensuring that rules are being followed. "At present, volunteers and enforcement teams are there but we want some partners with solutions that end manual monitoring partially or fully," he added.

211.title: Noida Police arrests 3 for issuing fake visas, charging up to ₹65,000
211.article_body: The Noida Police arrested three men for allegedly issuing fake visas and cheating people by charging ₹40,000-₹65,000 each for issuing such visas. The accused ran their office under the name 'Om Consultancy' in Sector-2 and offered job opportunities to victims in Gulf countries, the police said. The police recovered 15 passports and four visas from their possession.

212.title: Shark Tank India's Aman Gupta meets Tom Cruise at Wimbledon, shares pic
212.article_body: Shark Tank India judge and boAt Co-founder Aman Gupta met actor Tom Cruise at the final of men's singles during the Wimbledon tennis championship in London. Sharing a picture with Cruise on social media, Gupta wrote, "Fan moment for me meeting the legend, Tom Cruise...Jerry Maguire is my all time favourite movie and I couldn't resist telling him that."

213.title: He was kind-hearted: Varun remembers Sidharth on 8 yrs of 'Humpty...'
213.article_body: Varun Dhawan has penned a note remembering late actor Sidharth Shukla as their film, 'Humpty Sharma Ki Dulhania', completed eight years of release. Sharing some pictures with Sidharth, he wrote, "He was kind-hearted, protective...and always passionate about work and friends." Director Shashank Khaitan also shared a post for Sidharth, saying, "Miss you Sid, still cannot believe you're not with us."

214.title: It's script over language for me: Rakul on not doing Telugu movies
214.article_body: Rakul Preet Singh, during a question and answer session on Instagram, responded to a fan who asked, "Will you do any Telugu project or [do you want to]...stick to only Hindi movies?" "Of course, I'd do a Telugu film...I'm just waiting to do something different...Right now, I'm busy with projects here but for me, it's script over language," Rakul responded.

215.title: He's got the best serve I have ever faced: Novak on Nick Kyrgios
215.article_body: Novak Djokovic said Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios, who reached the final of Wimbledon 2022, has got the "best serve" he has ever faced. "He was cruising through his service games...It was...so difficult to read because he...always tosses at the same spot. He can hit all the angles," added Djokovic. Djokovic beat Kyrgios 4-6, 6-3, 6-4, 7-6(7-3) in the final.

216.title: Biggest Supermoon of 2022 to be visible on July 13-14
216.article_body: The biggest Supermoon of 2022 will be visible on July 13-14 as the Moon will be its closest to the Earth at a distance of 3,57,264 km. The full moon will appear slightly larger and brighter than usual for a couple of days. The phenomenon may cause tidal effects on the planet that may lead to coastal storms at sea.

217.title: Hyderabad police, other officials clear fallen trees from roads
217.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Monday tweeted that traffic police personnel along with other officials have cleared roads of trees that fell amid heavy rainfall. One of the trees was cleared from the Saibaba officers colony after the police received a complaint on their WhatsApp, while the other was cleared after it fell on the Choutuppal-Valigonda road, according to the police.

218.title: England Test side not a finished product yet: Brendon McCullum
218.article_body: England Test coach Brendon McCullum has said the Ben Stokes-led side is not a "finished product" and they need to ensure that their 'aggressive' approach becomes a norm for them. "That this style of play and what we're trying to achieve is completely authentic to us in any given situation and that will be the real challenge," he added.

219.title: Supporting Droupadi Murmu doesn't mean supporting BJP: Shiv Sena's Raut
219.article_body: Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut said that the party discussed NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu in their meeting on Monday. "Supporting Droupadi Murmu does not mean supporting BJP. Sena's role will be clear in a day or two," he added. "Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray will make a decision," Raut further added. "Sena does not take decisions under pressure," he stated.

220.title: Man accuses wife of stealing his pvt info for divorce case in Pune
220.article_body: A 40-year-old man has filed a complaint against his wife, father-in-law and his company's employees for allegedly stealing his private information from his office to use it in a divorce case in Pune. The complainant claimed that an office employee had forwarded information from his office computer to his father-in-law. The wife had filed a divorce case in 2019.

221.title: Sri Lanka President’s brother stopped from flying out amid crisis
221.article_body: Sri Lanka's former Finance Minister and President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's brother, Basil Rajapaksa was stopped from flying out of the country amid the ongoing economic crisis, immigration officials said on Tuesday. It was not immediately clear where Rajapaksa was trying to go. He resigned as Finance Minister in April as street protests surged against shortages of fuel, food, and other necessities.

222.title: Female Pakistani journalist slaps a boy on camera; issues clarification
222.article_body: A video of Pakistani journalist Maira Hashmi slapping a boy on camera has gone viral on social media. She could be seen reporting on the Eid al-Adha celebrations when she suddenly slaps the boy. Issuing clarification, she said that the boy was harassing a family and he didn't listen to her when she asked him to behave himself.

223.title: DM shouts on headmaster, orders to stop his salary for wearing kurta-pyjama in Bihar
223.article_body: The headmaster of a government school in Lakhisarai district of Bihar has been issued a show-cause notice after District Magistrate Sanjay Kumar Singh found him wearing a kurta and pyjama in the school premises. A video showed the DM shouting at the headmaster and  ordering to stop his salary for "looking like a public representative".

224.title: WhatsApp to now let users react to messages with any emoji of their choice
224.article_body: WhatsApp is rolling out a new update that will allow users to use any emoji as a reaction to text messages. Until now, users had the option of using six emojis: a thumbs up, a heart, a crying laughing face, a shocked one, a tearful one and joined hands. Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced the new feature on Facebook.

225.title: People trying to break Congress in Goa will fail miserably: Mukul Wasnik
225.article_body: Congress leader Mukul Wasnik said the people who tried to break Congress party in Goa "failed miserably". "Some people want to break the MLAs of different political parties, especially Congress...but Congress MLAs have shown them they're going to fail...miserably," Wasnik said. This comes after Congress accused some party leaders of conspiring with BJP to cause defections within the party.

226.title: TMC's Idris Ali is a terrorist: BJP MP Khan after statement on PM Modi
226.article_body: West Bengal BJP MP Saumitra Khan has called TMC MLA Idris Ali a "big terrorist" after the latter allegedly said that PM Narendra Modi will meet the same fate as Sri Lanka President Gotabaya Rajapaksa. Khan alleged that Ali is currently out on bail and is making such statements to please West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee.

227.title: PM violated constitutional norms: Owaisi on PM unveiling National Emblem statue
227.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi criticised PM Narendra Modi for unveiling bronze statue of India's National Emblem on top of the new Parliament building in Delhi and said that he (PM) violated all constitutional norms. Taking to Twitter, Owaisi said, "As head of government, PM shouldn't have unveiled the National Emblem...Speaker of Lok Sabha represents LS which isn't subordinate to government."

228.title: Would've destroyed Michael Jordan if I played against him: NBA star Morant
228.article_body: NBA player Ja Morant said he wishes he could have played against NBA legend Michael Jordan, adding that he would have "destroyed" Jordan. "I would have cooked Jordan," stated Morant. "Maybe you'll cook for Jordan, but you won't cook Jordan...It's...completely over the edge, delusional overconfidence, supreme overconfidence. It's just hard to swallow," read a reaction from commentator Skip Bayless.

229.title: UP woman poisons 3 kids, self over family dispute; all hospitalised
229.article_body: A woman allegedly poisoned her three children and then consumed poison herself over some family dispute in Uttar Pradesh's Hamirpur on Monday, police said. On noticing the children in an unconscious state, neighbours rushed all four of them to a hospital, police added. The woman did so as her husband and his brother were arguing over property, according to police.

230.title: Madhuri celebrates 25 yrs of Mrityudand, says 'Feels like yesterday'
230.article_body: Madhuri Dixit took to Instagram to share a few stills from her movie 'Mrityudand: The Death Sentence' to mark 25 years since its release. "Feels like yesterday. Gotta always strive to do our best. The journey continues...stay tuned #Milestone #Mrityudand #SilverJubilee," she captioned the post. Directed by Prakash Jha, the film also starred Shabana Azmi, Ayub Khan and Om Puri.

231.title: Truck hits vehicle in Suvendu Adhikari's convoy, 2nd such incident since July 1
231.article_body: A truck collided with a police vehicle in BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari's convoy near Kolkata's Kalikapur on Monday night, the police said and added that no one was hurt in the accident. Notably, this was the second such incident involving Adhikari's convoy since July 1. The truck driver has been arrested and he will be produced in court today.

232.title: If you don't want Kohli in your team, by all means, keep on the pressure: Swann
232.article_body: Former England cricketer Graeme Swann has said if Virat Kohli were an English cricketer, he would ask the media to take the pressure off the "star asset". He added, "If you do not want Virat Kohli in your team anymore, by all means, keep on heaping the pressure or if you value the asset, then go easy on him."

233.title: Russia, Belarus athletes might be banned from Paris Olympics 2024: IOC member
233.article_body: International Olympic Committee (IOC) member Craig Reedie has said that the Russian and Belarusian athletes might be banned from participating in the Paris Olympics 2024. "A decision is going to have to be taken on what happens to these two countries and my guess is that the general feeling would be that they should not qualify," Reedie said.

234.title: Chandigarh asks to axe 150-yr-old dry tree inside school for deaf, mute kids
234.article_body: The Chandigarh administration has written to its forest and wildlife department seeking permission to axe a 150-year-old heritage tree. Reports said the tree stands inside Vatika School for Deaf and Dumb Children in Sector 19. This comes days after a student of a city school died after a heritage tree fell on her during school hours.

235.title: Gurugram's 6-lane Sohna elevated road opens for traffic
235.article_body: The six-lane Sohna elevated highway constructed on National Highway 248 between Rajiv Chowk and Badshahpur was opened for traffic on a trial basis on Monday. The newly constructed highway will ease travel between Gurugram, Sohna and Alwar, and will also link Delhi-Mumbai Expressway. The 22 km length highway is built with a capital investment of about ₹2,000 crore.

236.title: BCom graduate who watched YouTube videos to steal cars arrested in B'luru
236.article_body: Police arrested a BCom graduate, Arun Kumar, for stealing cars in Bengaluru on Monday. According to police, he was previously jailed in a dacoity case, where a fellow inmate told him about an auto diagnostic tool that helps to break car locks. When he was out on bail, he purchased the tool, watched YouTube videos and started stealing high-end cars.

237.title: Video shows SpaceX rocket booster exploding during test, Musk responds
237.article_body: A rocket booster developed by SpaceX for its next-generation Starship spacecraft burst into flames during a ground-test firing on Monday in Texas. Responding to a livestream video recorded by the website NASASpaceflight, SpaceX CEO Elon Musk said, "Actually not good. Team is assessing the damage." It was not yet clear as to what caused the explosion.

238.title: Very heavy to extremely heavy rainfall warning in several states; IMD releases list
238.article_body: The India Meteorological Department has predicted isolated extremely heavy rainfall in Gujarat, ghat areas of Madhya Maharashtra and Goa till July 14. Meanwhile, isolated very heavy rainfall is likely over Madhya Pradesh, south interior Karnataka, Odisha, coastal Andhra Pradesh, Telangana and Chhattisgarh between July 12 and July 15.

239.title: 7,100+ people leave for cave shrine from base camp as Amarnath Yatra resumes
239.article_body: Another batch of 7,107 pilgrims left from base camp for cave shrine on Tuesday after Amarnath Yatra was resumed on Monday. Yatra had been halted after flash floods on Friday killed 16 people and injured 37. Reports said 15,000 people were rescued after flash floods. "Helicopter services for yatris continued from both base camps to cave shrine," officials said.

240.title: Car runs over biker after he hits another car's open door in Punjab
240.article_body: A 32-year-old biker was killed after he hit the door of a parked car when the driver opened it, following which he fell on the road and was run over by another car in Punjab's Zirakpur. The incident occurred on Sunday and the person riding pillion on the bike escaped without injuries. A complaint has been filed in the matter.

241.title: Bomb hurled at RSS office in Kerala's Kannur district: Police
241.article_body: A bomb was reportedly hurled at a Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) office in Payyannur in Kerala's Kannur district. The incident took place on Tuesday morning, Payyannur police informed. It reportedly did not cause any casualties. However, the window glasses of the building were broken in the attack, they added.

242.title: Model who spent ₹4.7 cr on 40 surgeries to look like Kim pays ₹95 lakh to be herself
242.article_body: Versace Model Jennifer Pamplona, after spending nearly $600,000 (over ₹4.7 crore) on procedures to transform herself into a Kim Kardashian lookalike, has now paid $120,000 (over ₹95 lakh) to "detransition" back to her former appearance. "People would call me a Kardashian and it started to get annoying. I was only being recognised because I looked like a Kardashian," Pamplona said.

243.title: Hear us out before taking a call on party symbol: Shiv Sena to EC
243.article_body: The Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena has moved to Election Commission (EC), asking it to hear it out before taking a view on any demands made on the party symbol by the faction led by Eknath Shinde, sources said on Monday. "It is kind of a caveat," an EC functionary said. Last month, nearly 40 MLAs walked out of Shiv Sena.

244.title: US First Lady criticised for comparing Latinos to 'breakfast tacos'
244.article_body: US First Lady Jill Biden is being criticised after she told a group of Latino voters in Texas that they were as "unique" as "breakfast tacos". "We are not tacos. Our heritage as Latinos is shaped by a variety of diasporas, cultures and food traditions, and shouldn't be reduced to a stereotype," the National Association of Hispanic Journalists (NAHJ) said.

245.title: SC extends Zubair's bail in Sitapur case, seeks UP govt reply
245.article_body: The Supreme Court on Tuesday extended the interim bail granted to Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair until further orders in connection with the case registered in UP's Sitapur. Zubair has been booked for his tweets calling three Hindu seers "hatemongers". The court asked the state government to respond to the fact-checker's plea seeking quashing of the FIR within four weeks.

246.title: Over 40 people booked for protesting outside Punjab AAP MLA’s house
246.article_body: Around 40-50 unidentified persons have been booked for protesting outside the house of AAP's Ludhiana South MLA Rajinderpal Kaur Chhina on June 8, Ludhiana Police said. A group of persons sat outside the residence of the MLA alleging a lack of power and water supply in their area, police added. They also tried to block her way, police further said.

247.title: Karthik has looked confused whenever he's played more balls: Chawla
247.article_body: Talking about Dinesh Karthik, cricketer-commentator Piyush Chawla said, "Whenever...Karthik has got to play more balls, other than the South Africa series, he has looked...confused." Chawla added that Karthik is a dangerous player when given four to five overs to bat. Karthik scored 29 runs in the recently concluded T20I series against England. He had a strike rate of 93.54.

248.title: The Great Khali accused of slapping Punjab toll employee; video of argument goes viral
248.article_body: A video showing The Great Khali arguing with toll plaza employees in Punjab after they accused him of slapping one of their employees is going viral online. The employee said that the WWE wrestler slapped him when he asked for an ID. Khali could be heard accusing the staff of blackmailing him.

249.title: 3 killed, 5 critical as speeding SUV rams into autorickshaw in Odisha
249.article_body: Three villagers travelling in an autorickshaw were killed after a speeding SUV rammed into the auto on Tuesday morning on NH-57 in Odisha's Sonepur district. Five others were critically injured in the accident and are undergoing treatment at a hospital, reports said. According to police, all three deceased were vegetable vendors who were going to sell their weekly produce.

250.title: Fraudsters pose as YouTube officials, extort ₹4.68 lakh from Mumbai student
250.article_body: An MBA student in Mumbai was defrauded of ₹4.68 lakh by fraudsters after the latter posed themselves as YouTube officials. The fraudsters extorted the amount from the victim by threatening to upload the latter's video call conversation with a semi-nude woman, police said. The matter was reported to the police after the 23-year-old victim narrated the incident to his father.

251.title: 'Barfi!', 'Tamasha' won't work in theatres today: Ranbir Kapoor
251.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor has said films like 'Barfi!' or 'Tamasha' won't work in theatres today as most people would prefer to watch such content from the comfort of their homes. "But when you make a film like 'Shamshera', and you want...box office collection, you cannot release this film on OTT because it's made for a collective audience," he added.

252.title: He's India's very own Mr 360 degrees: Aakash on Suryakumar's 117-run knock
252.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said Suryakumar Yadav's 117-run innings against England in the third T20I was not just "bravado" but also a lot about game sense. "A sense of knowing where the fielders were and where the bowlers were likely to bowl. He's India's very own Mr 360 degrees," added Chopra. Suryakumar's innings included 14 fours and 6 sixes.

253.title: It's very natural: Rajkummar on comparison with Vishwak Sen in 'HIT...'
253.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao, on being asked about the comparisons of his performance in 'HIT: The First Case' with Vishwak Sen, said, "It's very natural for people to compare...when two actors perform similar roles." "Comparisons will be natural, but they won't affect me...because I won't read them," he added. 'HIT: The First Case' is a remake of Vishwak-starrer Telugu film 'HIT'.

254.title: Probe ordered over boy seen sitting with brother's dead body in MP
254.article_body:
Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra said on Monday that a probe has been ordered into a video showing an eight-year-old boy sitting with the dead body of his two-year-old brother on the roadside in Morena. He added that the boy's father was given ₹10,000 from the Red Cross. 
"Show cause notice was served to civil surgeon," he further said.

255.title: Noida liquor shops falling on Kanwar yatra route to be closed from July 14
255.article_body: Noida district administration said all the liquor and meat shops falling on the Kanwar yatra route in the district will remain closed from July 14. A massive checking campaign should be conducted during the Kanwar fair, DM Suhas LY said. "One of the major routes starts from Ghaziabad where 'yatris' enter the jurisdiction of Noida at Chilla border," police said.

256.title: Govt will bring new rules to reduce scope to violate laws : Union Minister on Uber Files
256.article_body: Speaking on The Uber Files, Union Minister Rajeev Chandrasekhar said it was "disturbing that the big tech platforms have used technology and innovations to evade scrutiny and bypass laws." He added that the government is now determined to bring in "new rules and laws that will reduce the opportunities for them to violate Indian laws or do something illegal."

257.title: Lawrence Bishnoi wants public apology from Salman for killing blackbuck: Police
257.article_body: Delhi Police officer HGS Dhaliwal has stated that gangster Lawrence Bishnoi said his community members won't forgive Salman Khan unless he tenders public apology over blackbuck's killing. "During interrogation, he candidly said that since Bishnois consider the blackbuck to be reincarnation of...Bhagwan Jambeshwar, acquittal or punishment from the court won't be the last verdict," Dhaliwal added.

258.title: Uber was not legal in most countries under my jurisdiction: Whistleblower
258.article_body: Uber Files whistleblower Mark MacGann, who leaked 124,000 internal documents, said the company "was not legal" in most countries under his jurisdiction. "[Uber] was willing to break all the rules...use its money and its power...to destroy [taxi drivers'] livelihoods," he said. "[Drivers] needed somebody to be angry at...I became that person," MacGann said, revealing that he received death threats.

259.title: Doctors must offer abortion if mother's life at risk: US Health Dept
259.article_body: The US Health and Human Services Department on Monday said that healthcare providers must offer abortion services if the life of a mother is at risk. The procedures would be protected under federal law regardless of state bans, the department added. This comes after US Supreme Court last month overturned a nearly 50-year-old ruling that legalised abortion across the country.

260.title: French PM survives no-confidence vote, calls it 'political tactics'
260.article_body: French PM Elisabeth Borne on Monday survived a motion of no-confidence brought against her by an alliance of left-wing lawmakers. The motion required an absolute majority of 289 votes for the government's fall, however, only 146 lawmakers voted in support of the no-confidence motion. Borne called the vote "political tactics". French President Emmanuel Macron appointed Borne as PM in May.

261.title: Elon Musk responds after Donald Trump calls him 'another bullshit artist'
261.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has responded after former US President Donald Trump called him "another bullshit artist". "I don't hate the man, but it's time for Trump to hang up his hat & sail into the sunset. Trump would be 82 at end of term, which is too old to be chief executive of anything, let alone US," Musk tweeted.

262.title: Mother buries 3-yr-old daughter alive in Bihar; rescued by villagers
262.article_body: A three-year-old girl was allegedly buried alive by her mother and maternal grandmother at a graveyard in Bihar's Saran district. When the villagers heard screams from the graveyard, they got scared thinking it was a ghost but later realised that someone was buried alive. They removed the soil and found the girl with her mouth stuffed with clay.

263.title: India shouldn't become police state, new bail law needed: SC
263.article_body: India should never become a police state, said the Supreme Court on Monday as it asked the Centre to consider bringing a new law "in the nature of a Bail Act" to regulate bails. The court noted that the jails are flooded with under-trial prisoners while the rate of conviction in criminal cases remains abysmally low in the country.

264.title: Dad had told me 'Never do a film where you need to wear a dhoti': Ranbir
264.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor said his late father and actor Rishi Kapoor had told him to "never" act in a film that requires him to wear a dhoti as such films "never work". "Always do commercial films," added Ranbir, elaborating on what Rishi shared. "My father used to [say that my films]...aren't going to make me a national star," he had stated.

265.title: Will put burden of ₹1,000 cr on govt: AIMIM MP on renaming Aurangabad
265.article_body: AIMIM MP Imtiaz Jaleel has criticised the decision to rename Aurangabad, claiming that a Delhi official told him that this puts a "burden of around ₹1,000 crore" on the government. Alleging that people would also have to bear the "burden of several thousand crores", he said, "It's not like [ex-Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray or NCP chief Sharad Pawar]...would..help you."

266.title: Fire brigade rescues 2 as part of Pune building collapses; 2 hurt
266.article_body: Two people were injured and two others were rescued by the fire brigade after a part of an old building in Pune's Nana Peth area collapsed on Monday amid heavy rains. "It's a 70-year-old structure. The collapse...damaged around 30% of the structure," a fire officer said. The two injured people were taken to a hospital, the fire officer added.

267.title: 3 women pose as maids on Facebook, steal from homes in B'luru; arrested
267.article_body: The Bengaluru police have arrested three women who posed as maids and stole valuables from households. According to police, the women created a fake Facebook page titled 'Refer House Maids'. Once they received queries for housemaids, one of them used to start working and later fled with valuables, police added. All three are residents of Mumbai, police said.

268.title: Audiences want Hindi film tadka; KGF 2, RRR success proves it: Karan Johar
268.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar said the audiences want the 'tadka' of Hindi cinema. "The [success of] KGF: Chapter 2, RRR, and Pushpa: The Rise - Part 1 [proves theory]. We need to go back to [elements] we grew up on...drama, songs, dance, and emotions. The phase of small-town, high-concept movies is great, but this is reality of our time," he added.

269.title: BJP should clarify alleged links with Udaipur murder accused: Gehlot
269.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot alleged that BJP had links with the accused involved in the murder of Kanhaiya Lal in Udaipur and asserted that the party should issue a clarification. Gehlot further asked BJP to respond to allegations of helping one of the accused by requesting the police to drop a case filed against him for not paying rent.

270.title: Twitter shares fall by 11.3% after Elon Musk terminates $44 billion deal
270.article_body: Twitter shares fell 11.3% to $32.65 on Monday, two days after Tesla CEO Elon Musk terminated the $44 billion acquisition deal. In comparison to Musk's $54.20 bid, this is a 40% discount and the biggest daily percentage drop in over 14 months. Meanwhile, Tesla's shares closed down almost 7%. Notably, Twitter may file a lawsuit against Musk early this week.

271.title: I'm a thin guy, putting on muscle is hard; body building confuses me: Ranbir
271.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor, while talking about his physical transformation for 'Shamshera', said that "body building business confuses" him. "This was physically tough to do. I am a thin guy. So to lose weight is very easy for me, but to put on muscle is harder. It's very complicated," he said, adding that body building is an occupational hazard.

272.title: ISRO shares photos of double craters created by rocket hitting the moon
272.article_body: The Chandrayaan-2 mission of the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) has captured the site of impact on the moon after a used rocket hit the lunar surface. It shared before and after images of the lunar surface to show the difference after the impact. "The impact created a double crater which is 28 metre wide," ISRO said.

273.title: Siddaramaiah accuses Pralhad Joshi of conspiring against Yediyurappa
273.article_body: Congress leader Siddaramaiah accused Union Minister Pralhad Joshi of conspiring against BS Yediyurappa and removing him from the post of Karnataka CM. "Yediyurappa, who built BJP in Karnataka, was sent to jail...removed from the post of CM by whose conspiracy? Aren't you (Joshi) into it?" Siddaramaiah remarked. "Who finally removed him from the post of Chief Minister?" he tweeted.

274.title: Portugal on high alert as temperatures set to soar to 47°C
274.article_body: Bracing for soaring temperatures, Portugal on Monday raised its alert level to its third-highest of four levels. According to the weather agency IPMA, temperatures in some areas in Portugal could reach 46-47 degrees Celsius in the coming days. "This is not a very normal situation...It is serious in all aspects, even for our health," IPMA meteorologist Patrícia Gomes said.

275.title: Half of projected increase in population by 2050 to be concentrated in 8 nations: UN
275.article_body: The UN in its World Population Prospects 2022 report said that more than half of the projected increase in the global population between 2022 and 2050 is expected to be concentrated in just eight countries. The countries include India, Pakistan, Egypt, Ethiopia, Nigeria, the Democratic Republic of the Congo, the Philippines and the United Republic of Tanzania.

276.title: Video shows man riding motorbike with 6 children in UP; challaned
276.article_body: A video of a man riding a motorbike with six children in Uttar Pradesh's Auraiya district has gone viral on social media. When intercepted by the police, the man pleaded that he was taking the children for an ice cream treat after Bakri Eid and didn't have any other means of transport. The police issued him a challan.

277.title: FIR filed over sexual harassment of Delhi BJP woman spokesperson
277.article_body: A case of sexual harassment was filed after Delhi BJP complained that a woman spokesperson of the party was being defamed through a video posted on social media. The party said the video insulted the spokesperson's modesty electronically. The party further alleged that a group of people have been harassing its female spokespersons for the past two to three months.

278.title: Both Rishabh Pant and Karthik won't play, I want Pant: Vaughan on T20 WC
278.article_body: Former England captain Michael Vaughan said there is a "big question mark" on Virat Kohli's spot in the T20I side having scored 12 runs in the T20I series against England. Talking about the upcoming T20 World Cup 2022, Vaughan stated, "I don't think both [Rishabh Pant and Dinesh Karthik] will play. I want Rishabh in because he is left-handed."

279.title: Don't make Umran play T20Is, harden him in Tests: Madan Lal
279.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Madan Lal has said pacer Umran Malik should learn the craft of taking wickets in Test cricket. "Don't make him play T20 cricket. Get him to play Tests...harden him like that...He's a very good bowler but you have to make him a bowler," explained Lal. Umran conceded 56 runs in his four overs in the third England T20I.

280.title: IMD issues orange alert for Mumbai till July 14
280.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued orange alert warning for Mumbai till July 14. As per its forecast, the city and suburbs will have moderate to heavy rain for next 24 hours and there is possibility of very heavy rainfall in isolated places. Meanwhile, IMD issued red alert for Kolhapur, Palghar, Nashik, Pune, and Ratnagiri districts till July 14.

281.title: My unborn baby counts as passenger: US woman after being fined for carpool lane driving
281.article_body: A pregnant woman in US' Texas who was fined for driving solo in a carpool lane has said her unborn baby must be counted as a passenger. Brandy Bottone said her unborn child was a person in the eyes of the law as the US Supreme Court had days earlier reversed a federal law guaranteeing women access to abortion.

282.title: I was unsure whether it would work: Ranveer Singh on his OTT debut
282.article_body: Discussing his OTT debut with 'Ranveer vs Wild with Bear Grylls', Ranveer Singh said, "It was an experiment for me and I was unsure about whether it would work." "The good folks at Netflix...were way more confident than me," he added. "I was very excited to do something that hasn't been done before in the Indian entertainment space," stated Ranveer.

283.title: BJP looting people's money in name of development: Kumaraswamy
283.article_body: Former Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy criticised the BJP-led government in the state and at the Centre by calling it 'pro-rich'. "BJP government is looting people's tax money in the name of development," said Kumaraswamy. He further stated that if poor people are harassed in the country, then we too might witness a response similar to that of Sri Lanka.

284.title: Picture abhi baaki hai: Unacademy CEO on firm's cost-cutting measures
284.article_body: Responding to a journalist's tweet about the recent cost-cutting measures at the firm, Unacademy's CEO Gaurav Munjal tweeted, "Picture abhi baaki hai. Abhi intermission hua hai." Munjal on Monday announced a series of cost-cutting measures to turn the firm profitable. The measures included founders and the top management taking a salary cut and free meals being prohibited in their offices.

285.title: Bharti Singh and Haarsh Limbachiyaa reveal 3-month-old son's face
285.article_body: Bharti Singh and Haarsh Limbachiyaa have shared a video on their YouTube channel, revealing the face of their three-month-old son, Laksh, for the first time. Sharing the video, Bharti asked her fans if Laksh looks like her or Haarsh. Reacting to the video, a fan wrote, "So adorable...surely got Bharti's face," while another fan wrote, "Laksh is blessed with...best parents."

286.title: Ms Marvel is a moment for Pakistan, a celebration of who we are: Director
286.article_body: Pakistani-Canadian filmmaker Sharmeen Obaid-Chinoy, who helmed two episodes of 'Ms Marvel', spoke about how the show is a "moment for Pakistan". "So much of what you'd see...is a celebration of who we are and where we come from," she said. Sharmeen added the success of 'Black Panther' really pushed the narrative that superheroes could be in all colours and religions.

287.title: Delhi's neglected historical monuments to get facelift: Dy CM Sisodia
287.article_body: Delhi government has planned to give a facelift to its neglected historical monuments, Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said. While Malcha Mahal is set to get a makeover, museums will be set up at Dara Shikoh Library and Qudsia Bagh. Five monuments including, Birji Khan's Tomb, Bara Lao Ka Gumbad, Gol Gumbaz etc will be illuminated with tricolour lights, Sisodia said.

288.title: New UK PM to be announced on September 5
288.article_body: Britain's new PM will be announced on September 5, the ruling Conservative Party said. Eleven candidates have so far come forward in the race to replace Boris Johnson, who resigned last week after a revolt among his MPs and ministers. Johnson said that he'll not endorse any candidate running to replace him as he doesn't want to damage their chances.

289.title: England create history with 8-0 win over Norway in Women's Euro 2022
289.article_body: England defeated Norway by a record 8-0 margin in Women's Euro 2022 to register the biggest win in European Championship history. Notably, no side had ever scored eight goals in a single Euro match across men's and women's competitions. With the win, England have entered the quarter-finals after having won their first group stage game against Austria 1-0.

290.title: 15 key roads in south Delhi to be revamped for ₹23 cr: Sisodia
290.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has approved projects for the revamping of south Delhi's 15 road stretches at an estimated cost of ₹23.24 crore and the work will start soon. The stretches, which have a total length of 18.19 km, are located in several areas including Kalkaji, Greater Kailash, Malviya Nagar and Kasturba Nagar, officials said.

291.title: List of state-wise active COVID-19 cases released
291.article_body: The Health Ministry on Tuesday stated that there are 1,31,043 active COVID-19 cases in the country, with Kerala accounting for the highest number of active cases at 26,643. This is followed by West Bengal (24,209), Tamil Nadu (18,802), Maharashtra (18,027), Karnataka (6,718), Telangana (5,166), Gujarat (4,214), Odisha (3,084) and Uttar Pradesh (2,305).

292.title: Don't have time for trolls, people don't get what I say most of the times: RGV
292.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma said he uses social media to talk about issues he is interested in and he does not have time for trolls. "I also feel most of the times, people don't get what I say and they tend to misunderstand me...I am always the first one to even apologise if I am wrong," he added.

293.title: Make education system more inclusive for special children: HC to Haryana
293.article_body: Punjab and Haryana HC asked the Haryana government to make the education system more inclusive for children with disabilities. HC was hearing a petition filed by a woman and her 16-year-old son with Down Syndrome, who was allegedly "maligned and expelled" from a school. The school alleged the boy's unruly and violent behaviour was the cause of his removal.

294.title: India reports 13,615 new COVID-19 cases, active cases rise to 1,31,043
294.article_body: India has reported 13,615 COVID-19 cases, 13,265 recoveries and 20 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 16,678 cases and 26 deaths. Notably, India's active COVID-19 cases jumped to 1,31,043, while the death toll reached 5,25,474.

295.title: SpiceJet MD booked for allegedly cheating Gurugram man, airline responds
295.article_body: Gurugram Police has booked SpiceJet Chairman and MD Ajay Singh for allegedly defrauding a businessman. The complainant, who's a consultant in the aviation sector, has accused Singh of delivering a fake depository instruction slip of 10 lakh shares for services provided to him. SpiceJet said the complaint is "mischievous and completely bogus" and intends to hurt SpiceJet and Singh's image.

296.title: Over 800 children died in specialised adoption agencies since 2018: Data
296.article_body: More than 800 children, maximum below the age of two, have died in state-run specialised adoption agencies since 2018, as per official data. The officials said that the main reason for the fatalities is unsafe abandonment, including children being found with dog bites. Of the total 819 children, 481 were girls and 129 those with special needs, according to data.

297.title: Rupee hits historic low of 79.57 against US dollar
297.article_body: The Indian rupee hit a historic low of 79.57 against the US dollar during early trade on Tuesday. On Monday, the currency had ended at another record low of 79.44 per US dollar and had witnessed an intra-day high of 79.24. Meanwhile, Sensex declined 305 points to 54,090 and Nifty slipped 108 points to 16,107 in early trade on Tuesday.

298.title: Uber Files whistleblower reveals himself
298.article_body: Mark MacGann, a career lobbyist who worked for Uber between 2014 and 2016, has revealed himself as the whistleblower who provided The Guardian with 1,24,000 company records that constitute The Uber Files. MacGann, a 52-year-old Irishman, served as Uber's chief lobbyist for Europe, the Middle East and Africa and oversaw government relations and public policy in more than 40 countries.

299.title: Ranbir did high intensity cardio, had low carb diet: Trainer on Shamshera
299.article_body: Talking about Ranbir Kapoor's fitness regime for 'Shamshera', his trainer Kunal Gir said, "We trained five days a week, each session was an hour-long, followed by a...high-intensity cardio session called 'truck'." "RK would hold the treadmill's handles...and drive the belt with his legs...Ranbir [had a low carb diet and] was allowed a cheat meal only once a week," he added.

300.title: 5 people arrested in Hyd Old City for stealing goats during Bakri Eid
300.article_body: Hyderabad police arrested five people for allegedly stealing goats a day before Bakri Eid. According to police, the five-member gang had stolen 23 goats kept at a house at Noori Nagar. The accused shifted the goats in an auto and sold them to customers at Pebbair area in Mahabubnagar, police said. They were apprehended with the help of CCTV footage.

301.title: I was illegally trafficked to UK aged 9, forced to work as child servant: Mo Farah
301.article_body: Multiple Olympic and world champion Mo Farah has revealed that he was illegally trafficked to Britain at the age of nine from Djibouti and forced to work as a child servant. The 39-year-old, who was born in Somalia, added his name had been changed to Mohamed Farah from Hussein Abdi Kahin in the fake travel documents.

302.title: Dwarka Expressway delayed, to now wrap up in 2023: Officials
302.article_body: The Dwarka Expressway, which is being built to reduce Delhi-Gurugram traffic on National Highway-8, has been delayed by at least a year due to COVID-19 pandemic, senior officials in National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) said. The expressway, which was earlier expected to be ready by this August, is now expected to be ready by September 2023, the officials said.

303.title: 3 senior Congress leaders join Aam Aadmi Party in Uttarakhand
303.article_body: Uttarakhand Pradesh Congress spokesman Rajendra Prasad Raturi, Pradesh Mahila Congress vice-president Kamlesh Raman and social media adviser Kuldip Chaudhary on Monday joined Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) in Delhi. They were inducted into AAP in presence of Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia. The leaders said they quit Congress as infighting was increasing despite the party's rout in the state Assembly polls.

304.title: Gap's India-born CEO Sonia Syngal steps down after over two years
304.article_body: American clothing retail company Gap's India-born President and CEO Sonia Syngal is stepping down from her position just over two years into the role. The 52-year-old was appointed as CEO in March 2020. The company did not provide a reason for her sudden exit. Gap's Executive Chairman Bob Martin will step in as interim CEO effective immediately, the company said.

305.title: Kohli just needs one good innings to return back to form: Deep Dasgupta
305.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Deep Dasgupta has said Virat Kohli only needs one good innings to return back to form. "Whenever he's playing, it doesn't look like he's out of form. I don't feel he played a bad shot [in the third England T20I], maybe it was just his luck," added Dasgupta. Kohli scored 12 runs in two T20Is against England.

306.title: TMC leaders insulted Hindu Gods earlier too: Smriti Irani
306.article_body: Union Minister for Women and Child Development Smriti Irani reacted to TMC MP Mahua Moitra's "Kaali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess" remark and said that it is not "impossible" for TMC MP to insult the goddess. "TMC leadership had in the past several times insulted Hindu Gods and Goddesses," she said during her visit to West Bengal's Howrah.

307.title: Measures to decongest Hebbal junction working: B'luru authorities
307.article_body: The Bengaluru city traffic police on Monday said that the measures taken to reduce congestion at Hebbal junction have yielded results and the commuters are saving eight to 10 minutes while crossing the flyover. "There is improvement in traffic movement," said BBMP Chief Commissioner Tushar Giri Nath. Notably, the authorities have been tasked with finding ways to decongest the city.

308.title: Twitter user asks Mahindra about Tata Motors, he says 'Privilege to have such competitors'
308.article_body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra responded to a Twitter user who asked him his feelings about Tata cars. Mahindra wrote, "It's a privilege to have strong competitors like Tata Motors. They keep reinventing themselves and that inspires us to do even better...Competition spurs innovation." Commenting on his tweet, a user wrote, "There are few people who praise [their] competitors."

309.title: Iran to send hundreds of drones to Russia for use in Ukraine: US
309.article_body: Iran is planning to send "hundreds" of unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs), including weapons-capable drones, to Russia for use in its ongoing war in Ukraine, US National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan said on Monday. US intelligence also indicates that Iran is preparing to begin training Russian forces on how to operate these drones as early as this month,  Sullivan added.

310.title: 2 minor boys engaged in child labour at 2 firms rescued in Hyd
310.article_body: The Sheteams of Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police along with the Muskan team have rescued two minor boys engaged in child labour at MGS packing solutions and SS Polymers Private Limited companies, the police said on Monday. The owners of the companies were counselled, the police added. The police further said that the companies are located under the Choutuppal Police Station limits.

311.title: Delhi govt starts issuing fine for violating plastic-ban
311.article_body: Delhi government has started penalising violators found using, selling, manufacturing or stocking single-use plastic items. They imposed a fine of ₹1.2 crore on 119 violators and seized 16,359 kg of banned plastic on Monday. The ban came into force on July 1 but offering a grace period of 10 days, government had said it'd penalise the violators from July 11.

312.title: Ex-sarpanch of village near Pune killed as wooden shed collapses on her
312.article_body: A 46-year-old former sarpanch of a village near Pune was killed after a wooden shed of her house collapsed on her on Monday amid heavy rains, police said. The incident took place when she was working in the space under the wooden structure, police added. The victim was rushed to a hospital where she succumbed to her injuries during treatment.

313.title: Pune's Alandi civic body head's daughter-in-law found dead; 3 booked
313.article_body: A case has been filed against Pune's Alandi Municipal Council chairperson, her husband and son following allegations of suicide due to harassment after her 24-year-old daughter-in-law was found dead. The deceased, who got married last year, was reportedly found hanging at her residence on Sunday evening. The body has been taken for post-mortem, the police said.

314.title: 7 die in 24 hrs as heavy rains lash Gujarat, over 9000 relocated; 468 rescued
314.article_body: At least seven people died in 24 hours as flood-like situation was caused following heavy rains lashing several parts of south and central Gujarat districts. Officials, on Monday, said that over 9,000 people were relocated and 468 were rescued. Dang, Navsari, Tapi, and Valsad districts in south Gujarat and Panchmahal, Chhotaudepur, and Kheda in central Gujarat were affected.

315.title: 'James Bond' theme composer Monty Norman passes away at 94
315.article_body: British composer Monty Norman, best known for writing the iconic theme music for the James Bond films, died on Monday at the age of 94, his official website announced. "It is with sadness we share the news that Monty Norman died on 11th July 2022 after a short illness," read the statement.

316.title: India's cricket squad for Commonwealth Games 2022 announced
316.article_body: The BCCI have announced India's cricket squad for the upcoming Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022, which will feature women's T20I cricket. The squad will be led by Harmanpreet Kaur, while Smriti Mandhana has been named the vice-captain. The squad includes Shafali Verma, Pooja Vastrakar, Harleen Deol and Jemimah Rodrigues, among others. India will face Australia on July 29.

317.title: Shaadi.com Founder offers to find Nagaland Minister a bride; he says 'Waiting for Salman'
317.article_body: After Nagaland Minister Temjen Imna Along confirmed that he's not married and shared a screenshot of Google query of people seeking to know about his wife, Shaadi.com Founder Anupam Mittal replied, "Will have to do something @ShaadiDotCom." Responding to Mittal's tweet, Temjen said, "Bhai filhal hum bindas hai (Brother, I'm fine right now). Waiting for Salman Bhai."

318.title: I still feel 'very unconfident' many days when I wake up: Ananya
318.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday said she "still feels very under-confident" on many days when she wakes up as she doesn't feel she looks good enough. "I have those moments all the time," added Ananya. "As soon as I started working, people started saying things like 'You should...get a boob job or change something about your face'," she had shared.

319.title: Bengaluru to become free of stray dogs soon: K'taka Minister
319.article_body: Karnataka Animal Husbandry Minister Prabhu Chavan on Monday said the animal husbandry department is looking at making Bengaluru free of stray dogs. This comes amid several reports of dog attacks and rabies in the city. "We are...planning to bring them under one shelter where they can be rescued and properly taken care of so...people don't get any...disturbance," said Chavan.

320.title: Didn't breach our obligations under merger agreement: Twitter to Musk
320.article_body: In a letter to Tesla CEO Elon Musk, Twitter said it didn't breach its obligations under the merger agreement as stated by Musk after he terminated the $44 billion deal. It added that the agreement remained in place and it would take steps to close the deal. Twitter is reportedly planning to file a lawsuit early this week in Delaware.

321.title: Keep boxes of stones, pistols in shops: BJP leader to traders on Nupur row
321.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party legislator Vikram Saini, while addressing gathering of traders in Uttar Pradesh, asked them to keep boxes of stones, shovel bents and pistols in their shops. His comments came over ongoing controversy regarding suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma's remarks against Prophet Muhammad. "By the time the police come, they set your shops and houses on fire," he added.

322.title: Retired B'luru professor sues SBI over cyber fraud, wins ₹13 lakh
322.article_body: A 65-year-old retired professor of Bangalore University sued the State Bank of India after he lost ₹13 lakh of his retirement fund in a cyber fraud incident. The bank initially refused to refund saying the complaint was not made within three days of the crime, a requirement laid by the RBI. However, the court ruled in favour of the man.

323.title: Preservation of stone plaques of Mumbai's 150-yr-old Carnac Bridge likely
323.article_body: The Central Railway has said that they would try and preserve original stone plaques of Mumbai's 150-year-old Carnac Bridge. The preservation will possibly be done at the indoor or outdoor heritage galleries at Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (CSMT) or may even be embedded into the new bridge design. The bridge has reportedly been declared dangerous by IIT-Bombay in its audit.

324.title: Security guard shoots 22-yr-old man dead on suspicion of theft in Delhi
324.article_body: A 46-year-old security guard allegedly shot dead a 22-year-old man on suspicion of theft at a construction site in Delhi's Shahdara, police said. The accused found the victim and his friend roaming inside the premises and allegedly fired at them, police added. The deceased's friend told police that they had gone to the construction site to steal iron rods.

325.title: Deepest image of the early universe ever taken released by NASA
325.article_body: NASA has said that the first image from its James Webb Space Telescope is the deepest and sharpest infrared image of the distant universe to date. "Known as Webb's First Deep Field, this image of galaxy cluster SMACS 0723 is overflowing with detail. Thousands of galaxies have appeared in Webb's view for the first time," NASA added.

326.title: Twitter calls Musk's withdrawal 'invalid & wrongful', says he 'knowingly' breached deal
326.article_body: Twitter has sent a letter to Tesla CEO Elon Musk after he terminated the $44 billion acquisition deal. Terming his withdrawal as "invalid and wrongful”, Twitter said Musk "knowingly" breached the deal. "Twitter demands that Musk and...other Musk Parties comply with their obligations under the Agreement...to consummate and make effective the transactions contemplated by the Agreement," it added.

327.title: 9 cm tumour removed from 60-year-old patient's brain in Bhopal
327.article_body: A 9 cm tumour was removed from a 60-year-old patient's brain by a team of 10 doctors at a private hospital in Bhopal after a five-hour surgery, according to media reports. The tumour had reportedly spread to a quarter of the patient's brain. The man had fainted, after which the tumour was detected in an MRI scan, as per reports.

328.title: Security law use threatens Hong Kong's business hub status: US Envoy
328.article_body: Consul General of the US to Hong Kong Hanscom Smith on Monday warned China that the "crude and chilling" use of the Hong Kong national security law has endangered the city's international business hub status. "True patriotism is earned by winning the allegiance of free people, rather than futile efforts to legislate 'patriotism' and loyalty from above," Smith said.

329.title: S Africa confirms 3rd monkeypox case in tourist from Switzerland
329.article_body: South African health authorities have reported the third confirmed case of monkeypox in the country. The infected 42-year-old man is a tourist from Switzerland who showed symptoms including a rash, muscle ache and fatigue. "Three contacts have already been identified and none of them has developed signs thus far," a health official said in a statement.

330.title: EU recommends second COVID-19 booster dose for people over 60
330.article_body: EU health agencies on Monday recommended a second booster shot of COVID-19 vaccines for people over the age of 60 years and immunocompromised individuals. "We are currently seeing increasing COVID-19 case notification rates and an increasing trend in hospital and ICU admissions...driven by the BA.5 sublineage of Omicron," director of the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control said.

331.title: PIL filed against Mamata in Calcutta HC over her 'jihad' remark
331.article_body: A PIL has been filed at the Calcutta High Court against West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee over her comments saying that Trinamool Congress will declare 'jihad' against BJP in the upcoming Martyrs' Day event. State Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar recently wrote to the CM asking her to withdraw her comments. The petitioner's counsel called the comments 'unwarranted.'

332.title: 9 suspended after pregnant woman bled outside health centre
332.article_body: In Assam, nine health workers, including a doctor, have been suspended after a woman started bleeding due to labour pain outside a locked primary health centre. The video of the incident went viral on social media and resulted in district authorities taking action. The incident occurred at Khepre primary health centre in Assam's Dima Hasao district.

333.title: Bomb hurled inside Pakistani Senator's house by unknown assailants
333.article_body: A bomb was hurled inside the house of an Awami National Party Senator, Haji Hidayatullah, on Sunday in Pakistan's Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province, as per local media reports. No casualties have been reported due to the incident. The bomb was locally-manufactured and it was thrown inside the house by unknown assailants on a motorcycle, police said.

334.title: Kyrgios is a tennis genius, unbelievable player: Djokovic's coach Ivanisevic
334.article_body: Novak Djokovic's coach Goran Ivanisevic praised Nick Kyrgios, saying the Australian is a "genius, tennis genius." He added, "Kyrgios, for me, is the best server in the game by far. Unbelievable tennis player." Kyrgios lost to Novak Djokovic 6-4, 3-6, 4-6, 6-7(3-7) in Wimbledon final on Sunday. He was playing in his maiden Grand Slam singles final.

335.title: Mahira homebuyers in Gurugram demand delivery of flats before Diwali
335.article_body: Around 100 homebuyers of Mahira Homes in Gurugram's Sector 68 held a protest on Sunday, demanding delivery of their flats before Diwali in October. The Department of Town and Country Planning cancelled the project's licence in May, alleging the developer submitted fabricated bank guarantees and forged bank officials' signatures. The licence was cancelled when 80% of construction was complete.

336.title: My only house set on fire, it had 200-yr-old paintings & 2,500 books: Lankan PM
336.article_body: Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe on Monday addressed the arson attack on his home by protesters amid a raging economic crisis in the country. He said people with a "Hitler-like mindset torch buildings", adding, "My only house was set on fire. I had 2,500 books...my only asset." He said, "There were over 200-year-old valuable paintings. All of them destroyed."

337.title: We got a lot of lessons out of SL Tests to take to India next year: Cummins
337.article_body: Australia skipper Pat Cummins said the experience of playing Tests on two vastly different pitches in Sri Lanka would be important in their preparations for touring India next year. Australia won first Test by 10 wickets and lost second by an innings and 39 runs in Galle. "It's a good reality check for people touring over here," he added.

338.title: RBI fines three cooperative banks for non-compliance
338.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has fined three co-operative banks for non-compliance with certain guidelines. Nasik Merchant's Co-operative Bank was fined ₹50 lakh as it continued to accept fresh deposits in existing accounts of other non-scheduled urban co-operative banks. Maharashtra State Co-operative Bank was fined ₹37.5 lakh and The National Central Cooperative Bank in Bihar ₹2 lakh.

339.title: GSP Crop Science plans ₹500 crore IPO next year, says MD
339.article_body: Agro-chemical firm GSP Crop Science is planning to launch a ₹500 crore initial public offering (IPO) by next year, according to its Managing Director Bhavesh Shah. The Ahmedabad-based company plans to soon file a draft red herring prospectus with capital markets regulator SEBI, he said. Its revenue stood at ₹1,350 crore during the 2021-22 financial year, he added.

340.title: Gurugram Police files FIR against SpiceJet MD Ajay Singh
340.article_body: The Gurugram Police has filed an FIR against SpiceJet MD Ajay Singh over a complaint accusing him of delivering fake share certificates. The complainant, Amit Arora, alleged that Singh delivered a fake depository instruction slip worth ₹10 lakh for services provided to him. The police filed a complaint under Section 406 and 420 of the Indian Penal Code.

341.title: Emblem atop new Parliament was handcrafted by 100 artisans, took 9 months to finish
341.article_body: The 21-foot (6.5 metres) tall National Emblem that has been installed on top of the new Parliament building in Delhi was handcrafted by over 100 artisans who worked for over nine months to create it, government officials have said. The statue, installed 108 feet above the ground on Parliament's central foyer, weighs 16,000 kg with the emblem weighing 9,500 kg.

342.title: Woman poses as PA of ministers to cheat people, arrested in West Bengal
342.article_body: A woman has been arrested in West Bengal's Sonarpur for allegedly duping at least 10-12 people by promising them apartments. The accused identified herself as the personal assistant of Transport Minister Firhad Hakim and MoS for Finance Chandrima Bhattacharya, police said. She was arrested from her house on Sunday evening after a complaint was filed by a retired government employee.

343.title: I am absolutely against players taking rest: Sunil Gavaskar
343.article_body: Sunil Gavaskar has said he is "absolutely" against players taking rest. "You can't rest in IPL...but you want to rest when you play for India?" he questioned. He added, "If they want to take a rest, they can, but then all...guarantees should be taken away from them. The board needs to draw a line if they want to be professional."

344.title: Fan shares videos of theatre stopping 'Rocketry...' screening; Madhavan reacts
344.article_body: Actor R Madhavan has reacted after a fan shared videos complaining that a theatre in Kolkata stopped the ongoing screening of a show of his directorial 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect'. In the clip,  people asked for a refund. Resharing the post, Madhavan tweeted, "There must have been a genuine reason and cause. Please...be calm and show some love people."

345.title: We're nearing deal to buy cheaper diesel from Russia: Brazil Prez
345.article_body: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro said on Monday that the country is nearing a deal to buy diesel at a low cost from Russia, however, he didn't provide any details about the deal. Bolsonaro's remarks come as the state-run oil company Petrobras announced a hike in fuel prices last month. Notably, presidential elections will be held in Brazil this year.

346.title: Gavaskar defends Kohli, says 'When Rohit doesn't score runs, no one talks about it'
346.article_body: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar has defended Virat Kohli over criticism of his poor form. "I don't understand when Rohit Sharma does not score runs, no one talks about it," Gavaskar said. He added, "When other batters don't score runs, no one talks about it. Form is temporary and class is permanent. You are only asking about one player."

347.title: Over 800 children died in state-run adoption agencies since 2018
347.article_body: Over 800 children have died in state-run specialised adoption agencies since 2018, as per official data. According to officials, most of these deaths have been of children below 2 years of age and the main reason cited was "unsafe abandonment." Of 819 children, 481 were girls and 129 were those with special needs or disabled children who required extra help.

348.title: Thousands of diyas lit ahead of PM Modi's visit in Jharkhand
348.article_body: People lit thousands of diyas ahead of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's arrival in Jharkhand's Deoghar on Monday. PM Modi will inaugurate and lay the foundation stone of various developmental projects worth over ₹16,000 crore in Deoghar, which is a famous pilgrimage site in the state. PM Modi will pay obeisance at the Lord Shiva temple in Deoghar.

349.title: SC to hear Bhima Koregaon-accused Varavara Rao's bail plea tomorrow
349.article_body: The Supreme Court will hear the permanent medical bail plea of Varavara Rao, an accused in the 2018 Bhima Koregaon case, on Tuesday, July 12. Activist and poet Rao has challenged the judgement of the Bombay High Court which rejected his plea for permanent bail.
