The court, however, extended the time he could surrender at Taloja jail by 3 months.

350.title: Jonny Bairstow, Marizanne Kapp named ICC Players of the Month for June
350.article_body: The ICC voted England batter Jonny Bairstow the men's Player of the Month for June 2022. In June, Bairstow helped England defeat New Zealand 3-0 in the three-match Test series. Meanwhile, South Africa's Marizanne Kapp was voted ICC women's Player of the Month. Kapp won ahead of fellow South African Shabnim Ismail and England batter Nat Sciver.

351.title: If rising population a threat, why is China doing well: Tejashwi Yadav
351.article_body: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav on Monday stated that China is ahead of India in terms of the economy and GDP despite being the most populous country. "If the rising population is a threat, then why is China doing so well?" Yadav added. A United Nations report stated that India is projected to become the world's most populous country next year.

352.title: Trump's ex-aide agrees to testify before Capitol riot probe panel
352.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump's ex-advisor Steve Bannon has agreed to testify before the congressional committee probing the Capitol riot, days ahead of his trial for contempt of Congress. As per Reuters, Bannon's lawyer has written to the committee saying that Trump would waive the claim of executive privilege which had been cited by Bannon for refusal to testify earlier.

353.title: Delhi court summons Leena Manimekalai over 'Kaali' poster row
353.article_body: Delhi's Tis Hazari Court has issued summons to 'Kaali' filmmaker Leena Manimekalai and asked her to appear before the court on August 6. The petition, filed by Advocate Raj Gaurav, claims that the film's poster depicting a Hindu goddess smoking has hurt religious sentiments. The plea also seeks a permanent and mandatory injunction against the filmmaker.

354.title: Putin signs decree giving all Ukrainians path to Russian citizenship
354.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Monday issued a decree to fast-track citizenship for all Ukrainians "in a simplified manner" amid the ongoing conflict. Putin had already fast-tracked the Russian citizenship process in Ukraine's Kherson and Zaporizhzhia, which are partially under Russian control. Several parts of Donbas, which include Luhansk and Donetsk, are also under Russian control.

355.title: Mom rarely likes my films; told me 'What a film!' after watching Gupt: Kajol
355.article_body: Speaking about her mother's reaction after watching 'Gupt', actress Kajol Devgn said, "I remember my mother (Tanuja) telling me, 'Oh my God, what a film!'. And that's the highest accolade that I can get because my mother rarely likes my films." "She'd like my performances but not films...It was also the time when there was nothing else (mediums)," she added.

356.title: Judgment doesn't scare me but hope not to get unfair criticism: Arjun
356.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor said that one is judged almost every day for being a public figure. "The judgment doesn't scare me but I think unfair criticism is something I hope I don't get," he added. The actor further said a bit of that has happened to him but he has worked hard on himself and the choices he has made.

357.title: I don't take any win for granted: Djokovic after winning 7th Wimbledon title
357.article_body: Following his seventh Wimbledon title after defeating world number 45 Nick Kyrgios 4-6, 6-3, 6-4, 7-6(7-3), world number seven Novak Djokovic said he does not take any win for granted and "particularly not at Wimbledon." He added, "On the contrary, actually, every time feels a bit different, special in its own way." Notably, it was Djokovic's 21st Grand Slam title.

358.title: It was a gutsy choice: Kajol on playing a negative role in 'Gupt'
358.article_body: Speaking about playing a negative character in the film 'Gupt', actress Kajol Devgn said, "It was the shock value of the film, the character and the fact that nobody expected it to come. It was gutsy at that time to do." "It’s the story and role that’s what really got me to do it," Kajol said.

359.title: Video of PM unveiling National Emblem statue atop new Parliament building released
359.article_body: A video of PM Narendra Modi unveiling the handcrafted bronze statue of India's National Emblem on top of the new Parliament building in Delhi has been released by the government. The 6.5-metre installation is made from high-purity bronze, officials said. India's state emblem is an adaptation from the Sarnath Lion Capital of Emperor Ashoka.

360.title: Haryana Police STF arrests 5 members of Lawrence Bishnoi gang
360.article_body: The Special Task Force of Haryana Police on Monday said that it has arrested five members of the Lawrence Bishnoi gang from Bahadurgarh. Among those arrested are Chiraag, who is handling the drug trade of the Bishnoi gang and the younger brother of Tinu Bhiwani, arrested in the Sidhu Moosewala murder case and Manoj Bakkarwala, the country's famous car thief.

361.title: Delhi govt launches 15-day plantation drive in the city
361.article_body: The Delhi government on Monday launched a 15-day plantation drive in the national capital. The 'Van Mahotsav' plantation drive started from the Central Ridge and will conclude with the planting of one lakh saplings at the Asola Bhatti Wildlife Sanctuary on July 25, Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai said. Around 35 lakh saplings were planted in Delhi in 2021-22.

362.title: How does the WTC points table read as India slip to 5th?
362.article_body: After defeating Australia by an innings and 39 runs, Sri Lanka jumped to the third position on the World Test Championship (WTC) points table with 54.17% of points won. Meanwhile, India have slipped to the fifth position with 52.08% of points won. South Africa are on top of the table with 71.43% of points won, while Australia are second.

363.title: Comedians in India get slapped with sedition and defamation: Vir Das
363.article_body: On Monday, comedian Vir Das shared a clip on Instagram from his old standup show. In the clip, Vir joked about how in India, comedians often get penalised for "hurting sentiments". Vir said, "You come to an Indian comic and...tell us a comedian got slapped, we don't ask ‘by who?’ we ask 'with what?'" He then added "Sedition [or] defamation."

364.title: India's ferocity took us by surprise: Mott on England's T20I series loss
364.article_body: Speaking about England's 1-2 loss against India in three-match T20I series, England white-ball head coach Matthew Mott stated that India's ferocity of their attacking mindset took his side by surprise. "We learned a lot of lessons in the first two games," he added. England lost first two T20Is by 50 and 49 runs. They won third T20I by 17 runs.

365.title: 12 Goa Congress MLAs ready to join BJP: CT Ravi
365.article_body: BJP General Secretary CT Ravi on Monday claimed that 12 Goa Congress MLAs are ready to leave the party and join BJP. Ravi, who is BJP's in-charge of Goa, added that many Congress leaders and legislators are in contact with the BJP. Congress said it was seeking disqualification of party leaders Michael Lobo and Digambar Kamat from the Goa Assembly.

366.title: Sri Lanka will elect new Prez on July 20 as Gotabaya to step down
366.article_body: Sri Lankan parliament will elect a new president on July 20 to succeed President Gotabaya Rajapaksa, Speaker Mahinda Yapa Abeywardana announced on Monday. The decision, which was taken at an all-party meet earlier today, comes as Rajapaksa will formally resign from the post on July 13. Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe's office also confirmed that the entire Cabinet will resign.

367.title: Will not endorse anyone running to replace me as PM: Boris Johnson
367.article_body: Britain's caretaker PM Boris Johnson on Monday said that he will not endorse any contender in the race to replace him as the PM as that would damage their chances of winning. He added, "Whoever takes over from me, there is a great agenda to be continued...my job is to continue with the programme on which we were elected."

368.title: Public won't be affected by inflation in Delhi: CM Kejriwal
368.article_body: Responding to the increases in the prices of power production in Delhi, CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that the public will not be affected by the inflation in the city. The state government will continue its electricity subsidy scheme, providing 200 units of free electricity, he said. Those utilising 201 to 400 units of electricity receive approximately 50% subsidy.

369.title: I don't think I need the tennis, I am happy with the little things: Roger Federer
369.article_body: Ex-world number one Roger Federer, who last played competitive tennis at Wimbledon in 2021, said he doesn't think he needs the tennis. "I'm happy with the little things, like when my son does something right and when my daughter comes home with a good grade," he added. Federer stated, "I know a professional career can't last forever and that's okay."

370.title: Paytm record 8.5 million loans in Q1, 492% higher than last year
370.article_body: Mobile payment company Paytm said it recorded 8.5 million loans in first quarter of FY23, 492% higher than the same period last year. Paytm's disbursements crossed an Annualised Run Rate (ARR) of ₹24,000 crore on the platform. In June, the super app saw its highest monthly transacting users of 76 million, a 49% increase from year ago period.

371.title: Bank privatisation bill could be introduced in Monsoon Session: Report
371.article_body: The government could introduce a bill for privatisation of select-public sector banks in the upcoming Monsoon Session of the Parliament, CNBC TV18 reported. The government is awaiting the views of the Law Ministry on the proposed bill, the report said. The government may lower the minimum stake in public sector banks from 51% at present to 26%, the report added.

372.title: Was born with umbilical cord wrapped around my neck, had broken nose: Lauren
372.article_body: American dancer, actress Lauren Gottlieb opened up about her experience in a rebirth moment. She said that she was born with her umbilical cord wrapped around her neck and added that she had a slightly broken nose at birth. Lauren said that she took some time for introspection and prioritised her life with family, and her own welfare above work.

373.title: IOC, BPCL, HPCL may post combined ₹10,700 cr loss in Q1: Report
373.article_body: Indian Oil Corporation, Bharat Petroleum and Hindustan Petroleum may post a combined loss of ₹10,700 crore in June quarter, ICICI Securities said in a report. The three state-owned oil marketing companies are losing ₹12-14 per litre on petrol and diesel, the report said. "We estimate gross refining margins to remain fairly strong at $17-18 per barrel levels," the brokerage added.

374.title: Virat Kohli to miss first ODI against England due to suspected groin injury: Reports
374.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli has reportedly sustained a groin injury and is unlikely to play the first ODI against England, as per reports. Kohli did not come for the optional practice today ahead of the first ODI at Kennington Oval, reports added. The first ODI will take place tomorrow.

375.title: Temples submerge near Godavari river after rains in Maha's Nashik
375.article_body: Various temples submerged near the Godavari river in Maharashtra's Nashik due to incessant rain for the past three days. Several parts of Maharashtra have witnessed heavy rainfall over the past few days. Nashik received 68.4 mm average rainfall over the last 24 hours and it is likely to experience very heavy rainfall till Thursday.

376.title: Lulu's biggest Indian mall opens in UP, is made with ₹2,000cr & has 11-storey parking
376.article_body: Lulu Group's biggest Indian mall made with a ₹2,000 crore investment and spread over a 22 lakh square feet area has opened in UP's Lucknow. The mall, which has 11-storey parking, was inaugurated by UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Sunday. It has a food court with a seating capacity of around 1,600 people with 15 fine dining restaurants and cafes.

377.title: Sanjay's 'Munnabhai' character was inspired by my character in Tezaab: Anil
377.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor said in an interview that his character Munna in the 1988 hit 'Tezaab' inspired Rajkumar Hirani to write Sanjay Dutt's 'Munnabhai MBBS'. Anil mentioned his roles like 'Prem' from 'Woh Saat Din'...and 'Munna' from 'Tezaab'. He then elaborated about Munna and said, "Films were made on him because the character became so famous that they made...Munna Bhai."

378.title: What are the highest individual scores in last 10 overs of an ODI chase?
378.article_body: New Zealand's Michael Bracewell broke the record for registering the highest individual score in the last 10 overs (41 to 50) of an ODI chase. The 31-year-old scored 86 runs in the last 10 overs against Ireland to set the record. The previous record was held by Pakistan's Fakhar Zaman, who had scored 77 runs against South Africa in 2021.

379.title: Why did Djokovic's world ranking fall from 3rd to 7th despite winning Wimbledon?
379.article_body: Novak Djokovic's world ranking fell from third to seventh spot despite him winning Wimbledon. This is Djokovic's worst ranking in over four years. ATP decided to strip ranking points from Wimbledon in response to their decision to ban Russian and Belarusian players over Russia's invasion of Ukraine. As a result, Djokovic lost 2,000 points, the most among men's singles players.

380.title: CRPF jawan holds his family hostage for 18 hrs, later shoots self
380.article_body: A CRPF jawan allegedly held his wife and six-year-old daughter hostage for more than 18 hours and fired several rounds in the air from his machine gun, before shooting himself dead in Rajasthan's Jodhpur. Jodhpur Commissioner Ravi Gaur informed that the deceased's wife and daughter are safe. As per reports, the jawan had an altercation with his senior regarding leaves.

381.title: CBI files chargesheet against MHA officials in FCRA bribery case
381.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has filed a chargesheet against seven Home Ministry officials, among others, arrested in a Foreign Contribution (Regulation) Act (FCRA) bribery case, officials said. It is alleged that several officials were involved in exchanging bribes for facilitating clearances of foreign donations to NGOs in alleged violation of FCRA rules, officials had earlier said.

382.title: Bengal student leader Anis Khan was not murdered: SIT chargesheet
382.article_body: The Special Investigation Team (SIT) of West Bengal Police, probing student leader Anis Khan's death, on Monday ruled out murder as alleged by his family. The SIT, in its chargesheet, said Khan died after falling from the second floor of his home in Howrah on February 19. It has named five police personnel, charging them of negligence towards duty.

383.title: Arrest warrant was issued against me for disrobing Drapuadi: Puneet
383.article_body: Actor Puneet Issar, who portrayed Duryodhan in television series 'Mahabharat', revealed that a non-bailable arrest warrant was issued against him over the 'cheer haran' of Draupadi. "Someone from [Varanasi] had said that the disrobing of Draupadi that you did has caused hurt to us," he said. Puneet added that the person had wanted pictures with the actors of the show.

384.title: It lacked great brilliance: Toni Nadal on Djokovic-Kyrgios Wimbledon final
384.article_body: Analysing 2022 Wimbledon final between winner Novak Djokovic and runner-up Nick Kyrgios, Rafael Nadal's uncle Toni Nadal said it lacked great brilliance because there were too many points not played. He added that Djokovic once again proved that he is a great champion without the need to display his most "dazzling" game. Djokovic won his seventh Wimbledon title on Sunday.

385.title: Ready to lead new govt: Sri Lankan Oppn party SJB amid protests
385.article_body: Sri Lankan Opposition party Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) on Monday said that it's ready to lead new government to bring stability amid ongoing protests due to country's economic crisis. The announcement, which was made by SJB leader Sajith Premadasa, came after PM Ranil Wickremesinghe's office said that entire Cabinet will resign. Sri Lankan President will step down on July 13.

386.title: Shinzo Abe's party wins majority in polls held after his assassination
386.article_body: Ex-Japanese PM Shinzo Abe's Liberal Democratic Party (LDP), which is also Japan's ruling party, has bagged a majority in the parliamentary polls held two days after his assassination. LDP-Komeito coalition has secured 76 seats in the upper house of the parliament. Abe was campaigning for an LDP candidate in Nara city when he was shot dead on July 8.

387.title: Haryana govt increases security of MLAs who received threat calls
387.article_body: The Haryana government has increased the security of MLAs who have allegedly received death threats over phone calls recently. Haryana Legislative Assembly Speaker GC Gupta said, "Our five-six MLAs have received death threats. We're taking this seriously." Gupta added that he has discussed the matter with Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar and the Director General of Police.

388.title: Scam 1992 fame Shreya takes Mumbai train; complains of unreasonable cab fares
388.article_body: 'Scam 1992' fame Shreya Dhanwanthary visited the southern part of Mumbai. She posted how she travelled via train as it's way cheaper and takes way less time than the "unreasonable cabs". Shreya wrote on Instagram Story, “Local beats unreasonable cab fares and travel time. The fare was ₹1500!!! What in the world? What do they think?"

389.title: Massive congratulations: Jayawardena on SL's innings and 39-run win vs Aus
389.article_body: After Sri Lanka won second Test by an innings and 39 runs against Australia in Galle, Mahela Jayawardena tweeted, "Well played Sri Lanka." He added, "Massive congratulations to Dimuth Karunarathna, the team and support staff. Also to the selectors who had to make some tough decisions with COVID cases in the squad." The two-match series ended in a 1-1 draw.

390.title: Varun Dhawan celebrates 8 years of 'Humpty Sharma Ki Dulhania'
390.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan took to Instagram Stories on Monday to share a series of posts to mark eight years since the release of 'Humpty Sharma Ki Dulhania'. He wrote alongside one of the pictures, "Some great memories with amazing people." The film also features actress Alia Bhatt and late actor Sidharth Shukla. Varun also shared director Shashank Khaitan's story.

391.title: Fabulous innings, shame it came in a losing cause: Giles on Suryakumar's 117
391.article_body: Ex-England spinner Ashley Giles called India batter Suryakumar Yadav's 55-ball 117 in the third T20I against England "fabulous". He added, "Just a shame it came in a losing cause." India lost by 17 runs. He further said that Suryakumar played classy innings under pressure after India were reduced to 31/3. He hit 14 fours and six sixes during his knock.

392.title: RBI unveils mechanism to settle international trade payments in Indian rupee
392.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Monday unveiled a system for international trade settlements in the Indian rupee. The new system will be put in place to "promote the growth of global trade" and "support the increasing interest of the global trading community in INR", RBI said. The system allows for invoicing, payment and settlement of exports/imports in INR.

393.title: Jubliant FoodWorks' ex-CEO Pota to lead Advent-backed Eureka Forbes
393.article_body: Pratik Pota, the former CEO of Jubilant FoodWorks Ltd (JFL), will lead Advent International's portfolio company, Eureka Forbes. Pota will take on the role of Managing Director and CEO of Eureka Forbes from August 16 and lead the management team to continue scaling the business, Advent announced. Before JFL, he held leadership roles in PepsiCo, Airtel and Hindustan Unilever.

394.title: Man lands small plane on busy highway in US after engine failure, video goes viral
394.article_body: A video has gone viral online showing a man landing a single-engine plane on a busy highway in US after the engine started to fail. The video was filmed on the pilot's GoPro camera. In the video, several cars can be seen travelling on the four-lane highway in North Carolina. The man had less than 100 hours of air experience.

395.title: I watched Chak De India to stay motivated for Shabaash Mithu: Taapsee
395.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu said that she watched 'Chak De India' to get motivation for her film 'Shabaash Mithu'. "I need encouragement or inspiration. For this film, especially 'Shabaash Mithu', there were so many times I used to tell my colleagues...we should watch 'Chak De' before we start filming our climax to get into that zone," she said.

396.title: Sena's 16 MPs tell Uddhav to back NDA's President pick Murmu: MP
396.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Gajanan Kirtikar said 16 MPs of the party, who had attended a meeting called by Uddhav Thackeray on Monday, requested the former Maharashtra CM to support NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu. "She is an NDA candidate but Droupadi Murmu belongs to the tribal community and is a woman," ANI quoted Kirtikar as saying.

397.title: Congress MP Manish Tewari refuses to sign Oppn's letter on Agnipath
397.article_body: Congress MP Manish Tewari on Monday refused to sign a letter by the Opposition against Agnipath scheme. Tewari, who was one of the seven Opposition MPs to meet Defence Minister Rajnath Singh earlier today, was the only one to not sign letter that sought withdrawal or scrutiny of scheme. Notably, Tewari had earlier termed the scheme "reform in right direction".

398.title: 4 more dead in Amarnath cloudburst identified as Rajasthan residents
398.article_body: Four more people killed in the July 8 Amarnath flash floods have been identified as residents of Rajasthan's Nagaur. With this, the death toll in the incident from the state rose to seven. At least 16 people died and several went missing in the flash floods triggered by a cloudburst last Friday.

399.title: Punjab govt cancels textile park near Ludhiana's Mattewara forest
399.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann announced on Monday that the proposed 1,000-acre textile park project near Ludhiana's Mattewara forest has been cancelled. He further said that no industry will be allowed to come up on the river banks of Punjab to avoid any sort of water pollution. This comes after over 10,000 people assembled at the project site in protest.

400.title: Meat thrown in gurdwara premises in UP's Bareilly; case lodged
400.article_body: Police in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly have registered a case after meat was allegedly thrown into the premises of a gurdwara, a senior police officer said on Monday. Some miscreants tried to spoil the atmosphere of the city on Sunday night amid Eid al-Adha celebrations, he added. Police said a crowd had gathered at the spot after the meat was found.

401.title: G20 watchdog to propose first global crypto rules in October
401.article_body: The Financial Stability Board (FSB) said on Monday that it'll propose the first global cryptocurrency rules in October, following the recent market volatility. "The failure of a market player, in addition to imposing...large losses on investors...can...transmit risks to other parts of the crypto-asset ecosystem," FSB said. The FSB will report to G20 Finance Ministers and central bank Governors.

402.title: 'Population imbalance' shouldn't be allowed to happen: UP CM Yogi
402.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Monday said the population control programme must go ahead successfully, adding that "population imbalance" should not be allowed to happen. Having skilled manpower is an achievement for society, but when there are diseases and a shortage of resources, population explosion becomes a challenge of its own, the CM's office tweeted in Hindi.

403.title: Shinzo Abe's attacker referred to YouTube to make firearms: Reports
403.article_body: Tetsuya Yamagami, the attacker who shot dead ex-Japan PM Shinzo Abe on July 8, referred to YouTube videos while making the firearm used in the attack, local media reported. Yamagami said he had tested the gun at a facility connected to a religious group he believes Abe was associated with. Abe was killed while delivering a speech in Nara city.
